intro: Diplanthera tridentata, commonly known as the three-toothed germander, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers with three prominent lobes, giving it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface.
